page.title: 04RIVER SEVERN-IRONBRIDGE
page.content: On the River Severn they hold a Fishing Club. In June they catch eels. The fishing season begins on June 16th. You need a licence every year which costs Â£1.00. This year on the River Severn the R.N.L.I. held a raft race on May 20 1985. It was a two mile race from Buildwas to the Regatta fields at Ironbridge. 50 rafts took part and the winners were Visionhire from Wolverhampton who took 24 minutes 22 seconds. On May 6 1985 the Ironbridge Museum Trust held a fund raising plastic duck race. It took place from Buildwas bridge and ended at the Ironbridge. River wildlife includes ducks, swans herons and kingfishers. River fish are pike, salmon, trout, perch, tench, gudgeon, dace, chub, roach, eels, bream and rudd.
